summary: Patricia Orr is identified in payroll records related to the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). The documents include payroll certifications and notifications from the Assassination Records Review Board (ARRB) concerning the postponement of releasing Social Security numbers from HSCA staff payroll records. While the documents confirm her employment and inclusion in payroll records, they do not specify her role or responsibilities within the HSCA. The documents span from 1977 payroll certifications to 1995 notifications regarding the handling of HSCA payroll information.
key_connections: HSCA (U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations)
significance: Patricia Orr's significance lies in her being a staff member of the HSCA, as evidenced by her inclusion in the committee's payroll records. While her specific role is not detailed, her presence in these records contributes to the overall documentation of the HSCA's operations and staffing during its investigation into the JFK assassination.
